intro: Iozoste procera, commonly known as the tall larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stem and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and its flowers are typically arranged in racemes. Iozoste procera is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other toxic plants like delphinium and clematis. It is important to note that all parts of this plant are poisonous and should be handled with care.
